FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VIII
ExplntnTxt: DURING THE TIME YELLOWSTONE THEOLOGICAL INSTITUTE'S 501(C)(3) STATUS WAS PENDING APPROVAL, A FISCAL SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT EXISTED BETWEEN YELLOWSTONE THEOLOGICAL INSTITUTE AND BELGRADE COMMUNITY CHURCH. BELGRADE COMMUNITY CHURCH RECEIVED CONTRIBUTIONS FROM GILHOUSEN FAMILY FOUNDATION (BOZEMAN, MT) AND TRANSFERRED THOSE CONTRIBUTIONS TO YELLOWSTONE THEOLOGICAL INSTITUTE. BELGRADE COMMUNITY CHURCH RECOGNIZED THOSE CONTRIBUTIONS AS INCOME, SENT RECEIPT ACKNOWLEDGEMENT(S) AND MAINTAINED CONTROL OVER THE FUNDS PRIOR TO TRANSFER TO YELLOWSTONE THEOLOGICAL INSTITUTE PER THE TERMS OF THE FISCAL SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
ExplntnTxt: MEMBERSHIP SHALL CONSIST OF 1) INSTITUTIONAL MEMBERS, 2) OTHER ADMINISTRATORS, 3) AFFILIATE MEMBERS, AND 4) HONORARY MEMBERS. ONE FULL MEMBERSHIP (INSTITUTIONAL) IN MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS ENTITLES THE INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICTS (ISD) TO ONE (1) VOTE ON ANY ISSUE BROUGHT BEFORE THE ASSOCIATION. EACH ISD IS ENTITLED TO (1) VOTE ON ALL ISSUES. HONORARY MEMBERS WILL BE APPROVED ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS BY THE EXECUTIVE BOARD AND COUNCIL. MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE BOARD ARE ELECTED BY INSTITUTIONAL MEMBERS. EACH MEMBER HAS (1) VOTE.

ExplntnTxt: MEMBERSHIP SHALL CONSIST OF 1) INSTITUTIONAL MEMBERS, 2) OTHER ADMINISTRATORS, 3) AFFILIATE MEMBERS, AND 4) HONORARY MEMBERS. FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
ExplntnTxt: IN ORDER TO AVOID ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST PROBLEMS, EACH MAISA BOARD MEMBER SHALL, PRIOR TO TAKING OFFICE OR ACCEPTING APPOINTMENT, AGREE TO ABIDE BY THE MAISA CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. IF DISCLOSURE IS MADE, THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING SHALL REFLECT THAT; THE STEPS, IF ANY, THAT WERE TAKEN TO LIMIT PARTICIPATION OF THE BOARD MEMBER; AND IN THOSE CASES WHERE THE QUORUM WAS NOT ALREADY ESTABLISHED, THAT THE BOARD MEMBER WAS NOT COUNTED IN DETERMINING THE QUORUM. CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORMS SHALL BE COMPLETED BY ALL BOARD MEMBERS AT LEAST ONCE A YEAR.

THE MAISA EXECUTIVE BOARD DETERMINES THE SALARY OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. EACH YEAR HE RECEIVES THE SAME PERCENTAGE RAISE AS ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES.

ExplntnTxt: COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY: BOARD OF TRUSTEE MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE QUESTIONNAIRE TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT A MEMBER MAY HAVE. IF A CONFLICT IS DISCLOSED, THE CHAIRMEN AND THE BOARD TRUSTEE WOULD DISCUSS THE SITUATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 15
ExplntnTxt: PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION: OUTSIDE COMPARATIVE SALARY/COMPENSATION INFORMATION IS COMPILED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT AND REPORTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES USES THIS DATA IN DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT AND OTHER OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE COMMITTEE MET IN MAY 2014 AND REVIEWED A SALARY SURVEY AND THEN MADE COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE FULL BOARD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE OF FELLOWS DOES NOT HAVE MEMBERS; IT EXISTS TO HONOR THOSE AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF ARCHITECTS (AIA) MEMBERS WHO HAVE ADVANCED TO FELLOWSHIP, AS SET FORTH IN AIA'S BYLAWS. THESE FELLOWS ELECT THE COLLEGE'S OFFICERS - WHO COMPRISE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE - AT THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL BUSINESS MEETING. A VICE CHANCELLOR IS ELECTED EACH YEAR, AND A SECRETARY AND BURSAR IN ALTERNATE YEARS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE'S BYLAWS MAY BE AMENDED: (1) AT THE ANNUAL BUSINESS MEETING BY A VOTE OF NOT LESS THAN TWO-THIRDS OF THOSE PRESENT; (2) BY LETTER BALLOT BY A MAJORITY OF THOSE VOTING, PROVIDED AT LEAST 100 BALLOTS ARE RETURNED, OR (3) BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE COLLEGE OF FELLOWS AT ANY MEETING THEREOF, SUBJECT TO THE LIMITATIONS SET FORTH IN SECTION 1.3 OF THE AIA BYLAWS. ALL AMENDMENTS SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE AIA BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
ExplntnTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AT THE FINANCE COMMITTEE MEETING PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM 990 WITH THE IRS. THE HIGH-LEVEL REVIEW WAS LED BY THE EXTERNAL ACCOUNTANT (THE SIGNING PAID PREPARER OF THE RETURN). A COPY OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FINAL FORM 990 (INCLUDING REQUIRED SCHEDULES), AS ULTIMATELY FILED WITH THE IRS, WAS PROVIDED TO EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING BODY IN ELECTRONIC FORM VIA THE BOARD'S SECURE WEBSITE PRIOR TO ITS FILING WITH THE IRS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ANNUALLY SENDS A QUESTIONNAIRE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS, CABINET, AND KEY EMPLOYEES DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY (SUCH AS ALL DIRECTORS IN ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, CONTROLLER, DIRECTOR OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT, ETC.) ASKING EACH TO DETERMINE ANY RELATED PARTY/CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURES. RESPONSES ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE IF THERE ARE ANY POTENTIAL PROBLEMS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
ExplntnTxt: THERE IS A BOARD OF TRUSTEES COMMITTEE THAT SETS FORTH ANNUAL GOALS FOR THE PRESIDENT. HIS PERFORMANCE IS EVALUATED ANNUALLY (APPROXIMATELY JUNE OR JULY) BASED ON THE GOALS OUTLINED. HIS ANNUAL COMPENSATION AND ANY BONUS COMPENSATION ARE THEN DETERMINED AND APPROVED BY THE COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE ALSO USES COMPARATIVE DATA FROM THE IOWA ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (IAICU) IN DETERMINING COMPENSATION. THE PRESIDENT EVALUATES AND DETERMINES EACH CABINET MEMBER'S COMPENSATION USING IAICU DATA AND ANNUAL PERFORMANCE. EACH CABINET MEMBER HAS LONG-TERM PERFORMANCE GOALS IN THE STRATEGIC PLAN, WHICH GOES THROUGH 2015. ALTHOUGH ANNUAL GOALS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE STRATEGIC PLAN, EACH CABINET MEMBER HAS A CLEAR UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT S/HE IS TO DO.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY IS REQUIRED TO POST FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE PUBLIC DUE TO ITS HOLDING OF PUBLIC DEBT. THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIES WITH THIS REQUIREMENT BY POSTING ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON AN EXTERNAL, THIRD PARTY WEBSITE. FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: 990 PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 11A
ExplntnTxt: The organization's form 990 was provided to and made available to its audit committee for review prior to filing with the Internal Revenue Service ("IRS"). Subsequent to the audit committee review, the organization made its Form 990 available to all members of its Board of Trustees for their review. The audit committee is responsible for overseeing and approving the form 990, including the preparation, review and filing process. As part of its annual audit and tax return preparation process, the organization hired a professional CPA firm with expertise in not-for-profit tax return preparation to prepare the form 990. The CPA firm's tax professionals worked closely with the organization's finance personnel and various other individuals to obtain information needed to prepare a complete and accurate tax return. The CPA firm prepared a draft form 990 to be reviewed by and discussed with the organization's finance personnel and other individuals. Revisions were made to the draft form 990 where necessary. The CPA firm provided a final draft to the organization's finance personnel and various other individuals for final review and approval prior to presentation to the organization's audit committee and thereafter provision to all members of the Board of Trustees.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: 990 PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 12C
ExplntnTxt: The organization regularly monitors and enforces compliance with its conflict of interest policy. Annually, all trustees, officers and key employees are required to complete a questionnaire in accordance with the organization's conflict of interest policy. The completed questionnaires are returned to the organization's Chief Financial Officer, who reviews the questionnaires with the President and Chief of Staff to surface any potential conflicts that may need to be discussed at a subsequent board meeting.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: 990 PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 15A
ExplntnTxt: Compensation for the President is discussed and determined by the Audit and Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees, taking into account compensation packages of comparable organizations (e.g., higher education institutions and other education-related nonprofit organizations in New York City). The board discusses the President's compensation and applicable comparable salary data. The independent board members then determine the compensation without the non-independent board members present. The offer of employment for the President is formally extended by the Board Chair. 990 PART VI, SECTION C, QUESTION 19 The organization makes its 990 and financial statements available to the public upon written request.

Certain of these employees spend a modest amount of time providing administrative support for UKA. Effective January 31, 2014 Yvonne Chao resigned as Chief Financial Officer and took a role as a consultant for UKA. From February 1, 2014 through June 30, 2014, UKA paid her consulting fee.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
ExplntnTxt: THE FOLLOWING PROCESS WILL BE USED TO ALLOW THE TRUSTEES TO REVIEW THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO ITS SUBMISSION: 1) THE AUDITOR SUBMITS RECOMMENDED COMPLETED FORM 990 TO THE VICE PRESIDENT (VP) FOR ADMINISTRATION/FINANCE FOR REVIEW. 2) UPON THE VP'S APPROVAL OF THE COMPLETED FORM 990, THE VP ELECTRONICALLY SENDS THE RECOMMENDED COPY TO THE FULL BOARD ASKING THEM TO REVIEW THE FORM AND GET BACK TO THE VP BY A DESIGNATED DATE WITH ANY QUESTIONS THEY HAVE. 3) IF QUESTIONS ARE RECEIVED FROM THE TRUSTEES, THE VP IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OBTAINING THE ANSWERS AND REPLYING TO THE TRUSTEES PROMPTLY. 4) ONCE ALL TRUSTEE QUESTIONS HAVE BEEN ANSWERED, THE VP WILL SIGN THE FORM 990 AND INITIATE THE ELECTRONIC SUBMISSION TO THE IRS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
ExplntnTxt: EACH TRUSTEE IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND SIGN A STATEMENT ACKNOWLEDGING THEIR UNDERSTANDING AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY. UNDER THE COLLEGE'S PERSONNEL POLICY MANUAL, PAID OFFICERS AND ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES ARE ADVISED TO AVOID ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND ARE REQUIRED TO NOTIFY THE COLLEGE IMMEDIATELY SHOULD ANY SUCH CONFLICTS ARISE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
ExplntnTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROCESS IS USED TO DETERMINE THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT, THE VICE PRESIDENTS, AND ANY OTHER KEY EMPLOYEE EARNING MORE THAN $150,000 PER YEAR AT GOLDEY-BEACOM COLLEGE. PRESIDENT - THE CHAIRMAN OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WHO IS ALSO ALWAYS THE CHAIR OF THE FULL BOARD, REVIEWS AND DETERMINES THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE. IN HIS/HER DELIBERATIONS, THE CHAIRMAN GENERALLY CONSULTS WITH THE OTHER INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE CHAIRMAN AND ALL OTHER MEMBERS OF THE COMMITTEE, EXCLUDING THE PRESIDENT, ARE ALWAYS INDEPENDENT INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST NOT DRAW ANY BENEFITS FROM THE COLLEGE. THEY ARE ALSO REQUIRED TO SIGN A WRITTEN NO-CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST DECLARATION FOR THE RECORD. IN DETERMINING THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT, THE CHAIRMAN AND HIS/HER ASSOCIATES NORMALLY TAKE INTO CONSIDERATION THE WIDELY REPORTED AND PUBLISHED DATA OF PRESIDENTIAL COMPENSATION IN SUCH PUBLICATIONS AS THE CHRONICLE OF HIGHER EDUCATION AND THE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR HUMAN RESOURCES (CUPA-HR). AFTER FINALIZING THE DECISION, THE CHAIRMAN COMMUNICATES IT TO THE PRESIDENT IN A MEETING. VICE PRESIDENTS/KEY EMPLOYEES EARNING MORE THAN $150,000 PER YEAR - THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE INITIATES THE REVIEW OF THE COMPENSATION OF THE VICE PRESIDENTS AND ALL KEY EMPLOYEES WHO EARN MORE THAN $150,000 PER YEAR. IN HIS/HER REVIEW, THE PRESIDENT TAKES INTO CONSIDERATION THE COMPENSATION DATA PUBLISHED BY THE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR HUMAN RESOURCES (CUPA-HR). BASED ON THE COMPENSATION DATA AND THE PERFORMANCE OF THE EMPLOYEES MAKING MORE THAN $150,000, THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS AND DETERMINES THE NEW COMPENSATION FOR THESE EMPLOYEES FOR THE SUBSEQUENT YEAR. AFTER CONSULTING WITH THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE PRESIDENT COMMUNICATES THE DECISION TO THE RELEVANT EMPLOYEES ON THEIR NEW COMPENSATION IN FORMAL MEETINGS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL AUDIT REPORT IS AVAILABLE IN THE COLLEGE LIBRARY. WHEN A SPECIFIC REQUEST IS RECEIVED FOR A COPY OF THE AUDIT OR FORM 990, A COPY IS SUPPLIED. ALSO, THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC FOR REVIEW UPON REQUEST. THE CURRENT MISSION AND PHILOSOPHY STATEMENT ARE AVAILABLE ON THE COLLEGE WEBSITE AT WWW.GBC.EDU.

ExplntnTxt: COE COLLEGE'S BUDGET AND AUDIT SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES CONDUCTS A THOROUGH REVIEW OF FORM 990S FILED BY THE COLLEGE PRIOR TO BEING FILED WITH THE IRS. THE SUBCOMMITTEE RECEIVES THE RETURNS FROM THE PAID PREPARER, MCGLADREY LLP, AND THEN THE SUBCOMMITTEE AND A REPRESENTATIVE FROM MCGLADREY REVIEW THE RETURNS TOGETHER. ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE ADVISED OF THE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990S BY THE BUDGET AND AUDIT SUBCOMMITTEE. EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES RECEIVES AN EMAIL (1) PROVIDING THE TRUSTEE WITH ACCESS TO A COMPLETE COPY OF THE RETURNS THROUGH A WEBSITE ACCESSIBLE TO THE TRUSTEES AND (2) INFORMING EACH TRUSTEE THAT THE RETURNS ARE AVAILABLE FOR FURTHER REVIEW BY ANY BOARD MEMBERS AND THAT THE RETURNS WILL BE FILED BY THE DUE DATES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
ExplntnTxt: COE COLLEGE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ALSO COVERS THE K RAYMOND CLARK CHARITABLE TRUST, K RAYMOND CLARK ATHLETIC FACILITIES TRUST, K RAYMOND CLARK ALUMNI CENTER TRUST AND K RAYMOND CLARK RACQUET CENTER TRUST. THERE IS A RESOLUTION ADOPTING THAT POLICY AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FOR EACH TRUST. COE COLLEGE REQUIRES ALL TRUSTEES, OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES AND SUBSTANTIAL CONTRIBUTORS TO ANNUALLY COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE CONCERNING TRANSACTIONS WITH COE COLLEGE. THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT FOR THE COLLEGE RECEIVES COMPLETED QUESTIONNAIRES AND REVIEWS AND SUBMITS COMMENTS AND FINDINGS TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE AND THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD THEN REVIEWS AND INFORMS THE FULL BOARD OF ANY ISSUES OR ACTIONS REQUIRED INCLUDING MONITORING WITH AN OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE IF NECESSARY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
ExplntnTxt: THE BYLAWS WERE CHANGED AS FOLLOWS: ARTICLE II, SECTION 2: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WAS CHANGED TO CONSIST OF NOT LESS THAN 33 NOR MORE THAN 38 VOTING MEMBERS. TRUSTEES SHALL BE ORGANIZED INTO THREE (3) CLASSES AND SHALL BE ELECTED BY A MAJORITY OF THE TRUSTEES IN OFFICE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BOARD. EACH CLASS MAY INCLUDE ALSO A RECENT RECIPIENT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S SPARTAN AWARD AND THE LINCOLN LAUREATE AWARD. THE PRESIDENT OR ACTING PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY MAY SERVE ALSO AS AN ADDITIONAL EX-OFFICIO VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ARTICLE II, SECTION 4: VOTING MEMBERS (EXCEPT FOR THE PRESIDENT OR ACTING PRESIDENT) SHALL BE ELECTED FOR TERMS OF THREE YEARS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BOARD ON A ROTATING BASIS IN THREE CLASSES OF APPROXIMATELY EQUAL SIZE. EACH CLASS MAY INCLUDE RECIPIENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY'S SPARTAN AWARD AND THE LINCOLN LAUREATE AWARD. BOTH RECIPIENTS WOULD BE ELECTED TO ONE TWO-YEAR TERM. ARTICLE V, SECTION 3: THE EXCECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL MEET A MINIMUM OF TWO TIMES ANNUALLY AND SHALL MAKE REGULAR REPORTS TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
ExplntnTxt: AUDIT COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND THE CHAIRS OF THE TRUSTEE AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEES, AND CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THE DRAFT FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING. THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
ExplntnTxt: THE SECRETARY OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS CHARGED WITH CONTACTING ALL BOARD MEMBERS TO COMPLETE THE ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. FOLLOW-UP REQUESTS ARE MADE UNTIL THE FORM HAS BEEN COMPLETED. FOR STAFF, THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE SENDS A REQUEST TO ALL STAFF WHO ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. FOLLOW-UP REQUESTS ARE MADE UNTIL THE FORM HAS BEEN COMPLETED. THE CHAIR OF THE TRUSTEE COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS SUBMITTED BY ALL TRUSTEES. IF CONFLICTS REQUIRE ADDITIONAL REVIEW, THE UNIVERSITY BY-LAWS PROVIDES FOR A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO BE FORMED TO ADDRESS SUCH CONFLICTS. IN ADDITION, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST DISCUSSION IS ON ALL MEETING AGENDAS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
ExplntnTxt: THE SALARIES OF KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REVIEWED EACH YEAR BY THE PRESIDENT. A SCAN OF COMPARABLE MARKET SALARIES FOR EQUIVALENT POSITIONS IS DONE TO ASSESS APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION LEVELS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THE IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, CURRENT CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND VICE CHAIRS ARE MEMBERS OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990-EZ, PART III, LINE 28
ExplntnTxt: OPERATED THREE CLINICS, PROVIDING PREVENTATIVE TREATMENT THROUGH A PRIMARY CARE DOCTORS OFFICE AS WELL AS A WOMEN'S FREE CLINIC STAFFED WITH GYNECOLOGISTS. THROUGH THESE CLINICS, 339 PATIENTS WERE SERVED. THE CARE PROVIDED FREE OF CHARGE TO PATIENTS INCLUDES MEDICAL TREATMENT, DIAGNOSTIC PROCEDURES AND LABORATORY TESTING, SPECIALIST CONSULTS, MEDICAL EQUIPMENT,AND PRESCRIPTIONS. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE OXFORD FREE CLINIC IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF AREA RESIDENTS WHO FOLLOW THEIR PRESCRIBED COURSE OF TREATMENT TO MANAGE THEIR CHRONIC DISEASE AND ILLNESSES, DESPITE BEING UNINSURED OR UNEMPLOYED. BY PROVIDING CONSISTENT TREATMENT FOR THOSE WITH CHRONIC CONDITIONS AND SIGNIFICANT MONTHLY MEDICATION COSTS, THE OXFORD FREE CLINIC HELPS REDUCE THE MORE SEVERE MANIFESTATIONS OF THOSE ILLNESSES THAT ARE CAUSED WHEN A PATIENT NEGLECTS TO MONITOR AND TREAT THEIR CONDITION, DUE TO POVERTY. EARLY DETECTION SAVES LIVES, PREVENTATIVE CARE EXTENDS LIFE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 9
ExplntnTxt: IN CONNECTION WITH THE NMTC AGREEMENT ON AUGUST 24, 2011, THE NETWORK ENTERED INTO A VARIABLE-TO-FIXED INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT WITH A MAJOR FINANCIAL INSTITUTION AS A COUNTERPARTY TO OBTAIN A FIXED RATE OF 5.90% PER ANNUM. THE NOTIONAL AMOUNT ON THE SWAP AGREEMENT AMOUNTED TO $14,795,300 AT DECEMBER 31,2013. THE AGREEMENT EXPIRES AUGUST 24, 2018. THE FAIR VALUE OF THIS AGREEMENT RESULTED IN A LIABILITY OF $386,419 AND $996,266 AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2013 AND 2012 RESPECTIVELY. THE DIFFERENCE IN THE FAIR VALUE FROM 2012 TO 2013 IS $609,847.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: JOYCE GALBUT, THE ORGANIZATION'S CHIEF NURSING OFFICER, IS THE WIFE OF WILLIAM ZUBKOFF, THE CEO AND PRESIDENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
ExplntnTxt: THE CONTROLLER CONDUCTS A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 AND DISTRIBUTES TO THE GOVERNING BOARD BEFORE IT IS FILED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICTS COMMITTEE MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWS ACTUAL CONFLICTS THAT ARE IDENTIFIED BY THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE PROCESS AND PROHIBITS OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS FROM VOTING ON MATTERS WHERE ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST EXIST.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
ExplntnTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND OTHER TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS. HOWEVER, THE COMMITTEE IS INDEPENDENT WITH RESPECT TO ALL COMPENSATION RELATED DECISIONS IN THAT COMMITTEE MEMBERS REFRAIN FROM VOTING ON THE COMPENSATION IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISES. THE COMMITTEE UTILIZES COMPARABILITY SURVEYS PROVIDED BY AND INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE REVIEW AND APPROVAL PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN COMMITTEE MEETING MINUTES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART VII, LINE 1A
ExplntnTxt: ALL OFFICERS, KEY EMPLOYEES AND HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES ARE COMPENSATED BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, HEBREW HOMES MANAGEMENT SERVICES, INC., AND PERFORM SERVICES FOR ALL ENTITIES WITHIN THE CONSOLIDATED GROUP.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 9:
ExplntnTxt: CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF SWAP 609,847.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART XII, LINE 2B
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY OF HEBREW HOMES HEALTH NETWORK, INC. ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WERE AUDITED ON A CONSOLIDATED BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, PART XII, LINE 2C:
ExplntnTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM AND OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE WAS NO CHANGE IN THIS PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
ExplntnTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent public accountant and reviewed by the Vice President of Business and Finance and University President. The University does not consider it necessary to provide the return to the Board of Directors prior to filing.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12
ExplntnTxt: The organization adopted a conflict of interest policy on August 15, 2011, requiring annual submission of the conflict of interest form. Further, accounts payable has been provided with a list of board members and officers and notifies the Controller of all transactions with related parties for review. If it is felt a potential conflict may exist, it is brought to the attention of the Vice President of Business and Finance for review.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
ExplntnTxt: Compensation programs are determined by utilizing compensation median and mean data provided by the Council for Christian Colleges and Universities. HIU's President reviews this data with the independent Executive Committee of our Board of Trustees to ensure appropriate compensation levels are being approved. The independent Board of Trustees also reviews this data to ensure the President's compensation is reasonable. All Board approved compensation is documented in the minutes.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
ExplntnTxt: The organization makes its conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon request.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Part XI, line 9:
ExplntnTxt: Change in value of interest rate swap 25,121.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Part XII, Line 2c:
ExplntnTxt: The organization has a committee that assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit of its financial statements and selection of an independent accountant. This process has not changed since the prior year.
